column3: str
Greetings, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Have you come with a delivery today, or did you perhaps care for a spot of tea?

Ah, 'tis good to see you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. I trust the procurement of various odds and ends for the homestead program proceeds apace? I am ever so curious to see what wonders you will bring.

Thank you for your continued support, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. As I know all too well from my time as a student, 'tis nigh impossible to concentrate on an empty stomach─hence why I've a mind to keep a few luncheon coffers at hand, if I could trouble you with the task of procuring them.

Ah, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>─how are you? If you are ever in need of a respite, you are always welcome here. As we discussed, I would like as many mammets as you can prepare to aid the students' training.

Welcome, welcome! I was just thinking of you. You <Emphasis>will</Emphasis> stop by when time permits, yes? I've grown quite accustomed to your visitations, and it puts my heart at ease to know you are well.
What will you do?
Make a delivery (<Value>IntegerParameter(2)</Value> remaining).
Cast glamour on Ameliance.
Learn about custom deliveries.
Nothing.
What would you learn more about?
Satisfaction level.
Delivery requirements and rewards.
Procuring collectables.
Acquiring materials.
Increasing the value of crafted collectables.
Increasing the value of gathered collectables.
Increasing the value of fish.
Nothing.
With each successful delivery, Ameliance will come to trust you more and more, leading her to task you with assignments of greater importance.

This will be displayed in the form of a gauge atop the Custom Deliveries list. Fill this gauge to the maximum, and Ameliance's <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>satisfaction level<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>─as represented by little golden hearts─will increase.

Upon reaching a new <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>satisfaction level<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>, you will have the opportunity to learn more about Ameliance and her efforts to further establish the academic homestead program at the Studium.
In order to deliver an item, you must be its corresponding class and level 80 or above.
If you are level 89 or below, you will be awarded experience points instead of the level 90 scrips reward.
Should you find yourself unsure as to how to procure a particular item, subcommands and item descriptions can point you in the right direction.

For Disciple of the Hand items, choosing the <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Search for Item by Crafting Method<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> subcommand with the list selected will bring up the crafting log and the recipe for the item in question.

Likewise, for Disciple of the Land items, choosing the <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Search for Item by Gathering Method<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> subcommand will bring up the gathering log.
For knowledge on fish and fishing holes, refer to the item descriptions displayed when the list is selected.

The items sought by Ameliance fall into three categories: crafted items (obtainable by Disciples of the Hand), gathered items (obtainable by Disciples of the Land), and fish. Furthermore, Ameliance deals only in <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>collectables<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>.
Materials necessary to craft the collectables Ameliance seeks may be purchased from Synnove in the Agora.

The collectability of crafted items is directly related to their quality. Spare no effort in ensuring that the items you craft are of the highest possible quality, and you will be rewarded accordingly.

The <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Inner Quiet<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> status, granted each time you successfully increase quality, will serve you particularly well.

Accumlate as many stacks of the status as you can, then put the final flourish on your masterpiece with <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Byregot's Blessing<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>.

There are a host of other actions that can serve to further enhance the quality of items you craft. Once you've mastered the fundamentals, you are encouraged to experiment with varied approaches until you find your preferred crafting approach.
Before gathering a collectable item, you must increase its collectability.

One technique miners and botanists may employ to raise collectability is the use of <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Scrutiny<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> followed by <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Scour<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>. Try executing this combination a few times before gathering the item.

Gatherers seeking to procure items with higher collectability must be certain to equip gear with higher <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>gathering<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> and <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>perception<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> ratings, as these attributes influence the effectiveness of actions that raise collectability.

Of course, these actions cannot be used to their full potential without sufficient <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>GP<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>. A healthy balance of all three attributes is essential to make the most of your gathering.
The collectability value of fish follows a simple rule─the bigger, the better.

Upon arriving at the fishing hole or teeming waters where your desired quarry resides, use the <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Collect<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> action, then begin fishing or spearfishing.

When fishing, using <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Patience II<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> followed by effective hooking actions will increase your chances of reeling in a big one.

Should you still find yourself catching only small fry, try outfitting yourself with better equipment to raise your <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>perception<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>.

The items sought by Ameliance fall into three categories: crafted items (obtainable by Disciples of the Hand), gathered items (obtainable by Disciples of the Land), and fish. Furthermore, Ameliance deals only in <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>collectables<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>.
In order to deliver an item, you must be its corresponding class and level 80 or above.
If you are level 89 or below, you will be awarded experience points instead of the level 90 scrips reward.
Information on how to find individual items may be found in the following manner:

For Disciple of the Hand items, choosing the <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Search for Item by Crafting Method<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> subcommand with the list selected will bring up the crafting log and the recipe for the item in question.
Materials necessary to craft the collectables Ameliance seeks may be purchased from Synnove in the Agora.

Likewise, for Disciple of the Land items, choosing the <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Search for Item by Gathering Method<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> subcommand will bring up the gathering log.
For knowledge on fish and fishing holes, refer to the item descriptions displayed when the list is selected.
The higher an item's collectability, the greater the reward you will earn from Ameliance upon successful delivery.

To learn more about collectables and how to increase collectability, speak with Ameliance and select <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Learn about custom deliveries<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>.
In making your first successful delivery, you have begun to earn Ameliance's trust.

With each successful delivery, Ameliance will grow more and more satisfied with your efforts. Fill the gauge completely and Ameliance's <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>satisfaction level<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> will increase, giving you the opportunity to learn more about your new business partner.
You can make up to six deliveries in a given week. Deliver the items Ameliance needs, and deliver them often to win the trust and praise of your new business partner!

You have reached the weekly limit for deliveries. You may begin again starting <ResetTime>1203</ResetTime><Switch(TopLevelParameter(220))><Case(1)>Sunday</Case><Case(2)>Monday</Case><Case(3)>Tuesday</Case><Case(4)>Wednesday</Case><Case(5)>Thursday</Case><Case(6)>Friday</Case><Case(7)>Saturday</Case></Switch> at <If(TopLevelParameter(218))><Switch(TopLevelParameter(218))><Case(1)>1</Case><Case(2)>2</Case><Case(3)>3</Case><Case(4)>4</Case><Case(5)>5</Case><Case(6)>6</Case><Case(7)>7</Case><Case(8)>8</Case><Case(9)>9</Case><Case(10)>10</Case><Case(11)>11</Case><Case(12)>12</Case><Case(13)>1</Case><Case(14)>2</Case><Case(15)>3</Case><Case(16)>4</Case><Case(17)>5</Case><Case(18)>6</Case><Case(19)>7</Case><Case(20)>8</Case><Case(21)>9</Case><Case(22)>10</Case><Case(23)>11</Case></Switch><Else/>12</If> <If(GreaterThanOrEqualTo(TopLevelParameter(218),12))>p.m.<Else/>a.m.</If> (Earth time).

The quills you prepare will not only facilitate note-taking for lectures, but the transcription of rituals and spells as well. Pardon me while I take a closer look─the greater the aetherial conductivity of the instrument, the more conducive it will be to their studies, you understand...

The magical arts require an appropriate focus through which to hone one's skills─whether it is an array of nouliths, a planisphere, cane, or magical concoction, there are numerous options. Quality is key, however, so please bear with me while I take a closer look...

As a Sharlayan, I am all too aware of our propensity to prioritize nutrition over flavor in cuisine. Exposure to food from other cultures through the homestead program, however, has broadened many families' views on nourishment─you might say it's given us food for thought! But even the most delicious dishes can be spoiled if not kept at the proper temperature, which is why I must be certain this luncheon coffer is up to the mark.

As you know, mammets are invaluable tools for helping students gauge their capacity for aetherial manipulation. Everything from their clothes down to their very cores must be highly conductive to aether if we are to observe clear results. Now, if you will allow me to inspect...

The regions hit worst by the Final Days are in dire need of school supplies. It is my hope that by working together, we can make a difference. Goods with a long shelf life are preferred, but every little thing helps. If you'll allow me a moment to inspect...

When writing the particulars of a spell or ritual on parchment, much like ink, a quill highly conductive to aether will provide the best results. As feathers are the key material, I would carefully inspect each and every one─if you'll excuse me...

As you are doubtless aware, crystals are the primary catalyst of magical foci─and the purer the crystal, the greater its potency. Procuring those suitable to our needs, however, is no trifling task...

I know from experience that those engrossed in their work are wont to forget meals from time to time─students in particular. That is why I wish to provide them with new luncheon coffers. Of course, they will be of little use if not properly insulated. Might I have a look at the materials you prepared?

Mammets require a healthy supply of lubricating oils to keep their joints in good order. Not just any lubricant will do, however─the more impurities in the oil, the less responsive they will be to aetherial manipulation. Let us see what we have here...
The regions hit worst by the Final Days are in dire need of school supplies, so any resources we can provide will surely be of help. Materials fit for use even in harsh environments would be ideal.

In case you were wondering how writing ink is made from this cephalopod, the ink from its ink sac is first extracted, then mixed with a unique solution. The resulting precipitate is subsequently recovered, and voilà! The quality of ink varies between specimen, however, so I would prefer to inspect each one you bring individually. Let's have a look, shall we?
The seedtoad has a variety of uses, but is primarily utilized as a familiar at the Studium. A particularly resourceful one would make for a fine familiar indeed!
The way a meal is presented has an influence on its flavor, would you not agree? Well, most Sharlayans would not. Students from abroad, however, should undoubtedly appreciate the gesture.

Did you know a mammet's eyes are often made from a light-emitting material? The design offers myriad benefits, such as the ability to function in environments devoid of light. That said, it can be quite the frightful experience to find a pair of piercing, bright eyes staring at you in the dark.

The satrap of Radz–at–Han has graciously offered his full consent for natural resources from Thavnair to be distributed around the world and used in the creation of educational materials, all to provide aid to other calamity-struck nations. Coral of superior quality is certain to produce a vibrant-colored chalk to brighten any child's day.
I knew you would not disappoint! Indeed, I can find no qualms with the quality of your work.
My, this looks to be of remarkable quality! You have gone above and beyond. I suspect supply may fail to meet demand when word of this spreads among the students.

I...I am at a loss for words. This is simply outstanding! Should students grow accustomed to such immaculate craftsmanship, I fear nothing less will ever satisfy them again. I shall take great pains to explain the unique circumstances under which this has been commissioned.
Yes, this appears to be sufficiently sensitive to aether. The students will be pleased to have a mammet so well suited to practicing their healing magicks.

Thanks to your efforts, we have ensured a brighter future for children the world over. A dream, I suspect, some would have otherwise believed impossible. Perhaps, given time, all children will be afforded the opportunity to learn they so rightfully deserve.
Unable to obtain your reward. Your inventory is full.
To collect your reward, make room in your inventory and speak with Ameliance once more.
Perfect, this is more than enough for now. You've done amazing work, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>.

It occurs to me that, for all your prowess in battle, Alphinaud and Alisaie appear wholly unaware of your remarkable skills as an artisan. Perhaps I shall take this opportunity to boast of your many talents in my next letter to them.

I have wonderful news, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! The students have naught but praise for your marvelous supplies. Indeed, it appears the program is a smashing success! Why, even my former mentor saw fit to congratulate me. Rest assured, however, I told him I could not have done it without you.

I only hope the supplies have also been of use to Mila. Once she has a solid grasp of aether manipulation, I've no doubt our resources will further bolster her flourishing skills. Alas, I must give her the space to learn in her own time.
Ah, there's our master artisan. You'll be happy to hear students have been quite pleased with their meals of late, thanks in no small part to your luncheon coffers.

When they attended the Studium, Alisaie would always request her meals be prepared, while Alphinaud was always quite happy to sate his appetite with Archon loaf─each and every day. A peculiar trait he inherited from his father.
Your generosity knows no bounds, and I fear we Leveilleurs have come to rely overmuch on your giving nature. Would that we could simply adopt you into the family, if only to ease my guilt.

Fear not─I merely jest. Besides, the paperwork alone would surely strike fear even in Fourchenault's heart... Oh, but listen to me prattle on while Mila prepares to return home to Thavnair. I should be helping with preparations. It pains me that she must leave, but it's for the best.
I-I've returned from the Studium, Lady Ameliance!
Welcome home, Mila. How was your first day of classes?
Oh, it was wonderful! Not only the professors, but my classmates too were astonishingly friendly─I can hardly believe how many friends I've already made!
That is reassuring to hear. And I must say, you wear the uniform quite well.

Goodness, you're making me blush! ...Thank you, Lady Ameliance. Not <Emphasis>just</Emphasis> for the compliment, but for everything. Once I have learned to wield spells from my studies here, I can return home triumphant having proved my mother wrong!
...Would you care to elaborate?
Ah, yes─of course. For generations, those in my family have traditionally become alchemists, each of us pouring our hearts and souls into the creation of medicine.
The Final Days, however, changed everything. I saw firsthand that there are countless lives not even the most advanced medicine can save...

I came to the decision that I must learn to wield magic, even if it meant traveling as far as Sharlayan. Against my mother's wishes─but at my father's urging─I took my chances, and made the journey here.
You have been through an awful lot... Why, pray tell, is your mother so opposed to your learning spellcraft?

I cannot say for certain, but...alchemy has long been a source of pride for my family. She may find my decision to study an alternate discipline offensive, as though I am rejecting my lineage in some way─which simply isn't the case!

Though I love alchemy, I am not so beholden to it that I'm blind to its shortcomings. To me, the decision is simple: if magic can save more lives than medicine, then I must learn to wield it. Even if it breaks my mother's heart.
...With all that said, I still hardly know left from right when it comes to spellcraft. I'm surprised my application for the academic homestead was even accepted in the first place.
You have earned your place here, Mila. Nothing more, nothing less. But thank you for speaking so candidly with us. Know that you have our full support─whatever you need, pray do not hesitate to ask.
You are both far too kind! I have a lot of ground to make up, but I promise I won't let you down!
Hello, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! I didn't realize you were visiting. Actually, there was something I wanted to tell you...
I really appreciate the work you've done, procuring all sorts of things for myself and the other students─your support has meant the world to us! So...thank you!
Well then, I'd better be off─a lot of spells to practice, and so little time. I mustn't drag my feet, lest I get left behind my peers!
Just a moment, Mila.
I could not help but notice that you seem a touch out of sorts... Pray tell, is something the matter?
Wh-Whatever do you mean? I couldn't feel better!
...Are you sure? Though faint, the gauntness of your cheeks indicates otherwise.
I have no doubts you enjoy your meals here at home, but I cannot speak for elsewhere... What can you tell me of the food at the Studium?
U-Um...

Aha! As I thought. Believe it or not, meals at the Studium were considered <Emphasis>gruesome</Emphasis>─to put it lightly─even in my day. A damning statement considering our woefully low culinary standards.
Forgive me for not noticing sooner, Mila. From now on, I shall personally prepare lunch for you!
Wh-What!? No, no, I couldn't bear to inconvenience you any further!
Inconvenience? Don't be ridiculous─we are family, my dear!
Right then! I'd love to learn how to cook Thavnairian dishes, if you would care to teach me. Come, let us away to the kitchen!
L-Lady Ameliance, we servants would be happy to serve anything you wish! I must insist that you leave the cooking to us!

Thank you, Meryld, but that won't be necessary. Though I am out of practice, I am not wholly bereft of culinary skill. After all, it was I who often prepared luncheon coffers for Fourchenault when we were students. And I'm quite glad I did─his propensity for Archon loaf would have ruined his figure otherwise.
Now─let us go and put the kitchen to good use, shall we?
Y-Yes!
B-But! Lady Ameliance, p-please reconsider!
There is a matter I wish to discuss with you.
It concerns Mila... I fear she may be having difficulty with spellcraft.
'Tis a complex art that cannot be learned quickly, nor through pure effort─one must have the aptitude for it.

Fortunately, from what I've observed, Mila appears to have not only the capacity to wield magic, but also a clear understanding of how it works─in theory, at least. And, as you have seen yourself, she holds a strong desire to succeed.
But I fear her determination is merely born of stubbornness... With each passing day, she returns home later and later.
Lest you wonder, being the considerate soul that she is, Mila always sends word in advance. Even today she notified me that she would be studying on campus until late.
I understand all too well the desire to prove oneself, but it should never come at the cost of one's own health. I must speak with her immediately, before she falls ill─or worse.
You may think me overprotective, but she is still just a child. I have a duty to look after her, both as a mother and a friend.
...Yet the Studium is ever so large, is it not? I would be eternally grateful if you would help me search for her.
Wonderful! You need but say the word─I am ready to leave at a moment's notice.

Lady Ameliance, Meryld, and <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>... Though my time in Sharlayan was short, full glad am I that I was able to spend it with you. There are no words with which I can adequately express my gratitude.
My, how time flies. It seems like it was only yesterday you first walked through those doors... I will miss you dearly, Mila, but I know all too well how your parents must be feeling.

I know I have said it many times, but please let me say it once more: thank you─from the bottom of my heart. Countless students, myself included, never would have been able to study abroad if not for your support.
I can scarcely imagine how my studies would have turned out had it not been for the amazing resources you and Lady Ameliance prepared...
And, while I don't quite have something to offer as thanks, I do have something to show you.
Here I go...
(Now collapse, just as I practiced...)
My word! You've learned to control it with such finesse!
Oh, I can do more than that...
Mila... How─ <Emphasis>When</Emphasis> did you learn to wield healing magicks like that?
Ah, but that is beside the point. This is the fruit borne of your hard work, and I could not be prouder of you!

It fills me with such joy to hear you say those words...but I must give credit where credit is due. I have <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/> to thank for all of <If(PlayerParameter(4))>her<Else/>his</If> wonderful supplies, the professors at the Studium for their patient instruction, and you most of all, Lady Ameliance, for always believing in me!
There is something you should know... I have decided to pursue alchemy when I return home.
By studying the art of spellcraft, I feel that I have come to understand the advantages and disadvantages inherent between the two disciplines.

It was when I first came to this realization that an idea sprung to mind─what if I were to master <Emphasis>both</Emphasis>? I could compensate for the weaknesses of one with the strengths of the other, and help even more people that way.
What I'm trying to say is...once I finish my training with alchemy, I <Emphasis>will</Emphasis> return here! This, I promise you, Lady Ameliance!
So...when that day comes, may I visit you again?
Mila! You hardly need ask. It's a promise.
There was just one other matter. Everyone in the house came together to prepare a parting gift for you. I do hope you'll like it.
Gods, these clothes...they're so beautiful I could cry! Thank you, thank you, thank you!
As a master artisan, what do you think, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>? Do they suit me?
I am thrilled─if not a touch relieved─that you like it. I pray it serves as a lasting reminder of your time here.
Oh, I could never forget anything about this place. Not the people I've met, nor the memories I've made...all of it, I will treasure forever.
Miss Miladeen, I'm afraid the time of your ship's departure draws near. We had best be setting off.
...I knew this moment would come, but even so, I'm not ready to bid farewell. And after receiving such a lovely gift...
Everyone, I...I will miss you all so much...
And we, you, Mila. Safe travels, and know that we will always be thinking of you. May your journey in life be one full of love and laughter─the selfsame gifts you gave to all of us.
Th-Thank you, Lady Ameliance! ...I will do my best. Until we meet again!
I've no doubt there are other students from abroad who, much like Mila, yet struggle with their spellcraft.

As such, supplemental tools for their studies shall prove beneficial─toads and magical foci most of all. The better the quality, the more quickly they shall be able to master the basics. I trust I can count on your assistance?
Marvelous! Thank you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>.

'Tis only natural Mila would grow homesick, and yet somehow I failed to notice. A taste of home from time to time would no doubt lift her spirits, but we've only the bland cuisine of Sharlayan to offer her. Which is why I suspect that, rather than endure the questionable repast of the Studium, she chooses to suffer pangs of both longing and hunger when she's away.

It breaks my heart to think that there may be other students suffering in silence just as Mila did. To err on the side of caution, I will advise the other homestead families to be particularly mindful when it comes to matters of nourishment.

Speaking of which, students who share Mila's passion for learning are often wont to remain at the Studium from their first classes in the morning until well after the last bell. Luncheon coffers able to keep their food fresh during those long hours would go a long way to quell any dietary issues they may have. I trust I can count on you to supply the requisite coffers?
It never gets easier watching them leave. You can only hope you've done enough to prepare them for what will come next.

...But I should not burden you with such musings─certainly not when I have good news to share. Several homestead families have informed me that the students in their care were able to finish their studies in Sharlayan, and return home safely. An accomplishment we could not have achieved without you.
Our success here has inspired me to look beyond Sharlayan's borders. There is no time for idleness. Not when there are still children who lack for opportunities to better themselves.
Which is not to say I will be refusing more students for academic homestead─far from it!

Though, it would be something of a shock for Alphinaud and Alisaie to find what they believe to be a stranger boarding in our home. And if Fourchenault were to find out... Well, I must simply see to it that he doesn't.
Now, before I forget, I do hope you liked the attire we made for Mila, because I have another set being prepared for you as we speak.
Naturally, we needed to finish hers first, but yours will be ready shortly.

While we're on the subject of dress, I would ask a favor of you, but please─not a word of this to anyone. If you happen upon any garments you think may suit me in your travels, I should like to borrow them, if only for a short while. And if they would put Fourchenault to the blush, all the better!

Ameliance is pleased with your efforts. She now considers you <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Appointed to House Leveilleur<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>!

Ameliance is delighted with your efforts. She now considers you a <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Benefactor of House Leveilleur<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>!

Ameliance is overjoyed with your efforts. She now considers you the <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Champion of House Leveilleur<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>!

Ameliance could not be happier with your efforts. She now considers you the <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Honorary Scion of House Leveilleur<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>!

And yet there is still much work to be done if she is to ensure students enrolled in the academic homestead program feel at home in Old Sharlayan. To that end, Ameliance has a new favor to ask of you...
Through your efforts, the academic homestead program in Old Sharlayan was a resounding success. It seems, however, that Ameliance has a new favor to ask of you...

The Custom Deliveries list for Ameliance has been updated. To view the new list, speak with Ameliance and select <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Make a delivery<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>.

A new quest continuing the story of Ameliance's efforts with the academic homestead program in Old Sharlayan is now available. Upon its completion, the Custom Deliveries list for Ameliance will be updated.
Future requests will be selected at random from all those you have seen thus far, with the list refreshed once a week (Earth time).

You may review the items currently in demand at any time by speaking with Ameliance and selecting <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Make a delivery<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>.

Note that school supplies, school supply materials, and chalky coral will earn you particularly handsome rewards. Whenever they make an appearance, the effort to procure them will be worth your while.
Furthermore, Ameliance's appearance may now be altered through the use of glamours.
Thank you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Not only for procuring supplies, but for believing in my vision.

After everything I have heard of your grand adventures with Alphinaud and Alisaie, never in my wildest dreams did I believe we might find ourselves working together. But I could not have asked for a better partner.
Thank you for yet another incredible round of deliveries, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! Words can ill express what a boon your help has been to the homestead program.
And I would like to think we have become good friends through our work together, as well. Fourchenault would no doubt be shocked─perhaps even envious─were he to see what we've accomplished thus far.
Your generosity knows no bounds, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! I cannot thank you enough.
'Tis not mine intent to embarrass, you understand, but each time you visit, the servants are always quite excited to see you. To say your very presence is an inspiration would be an understatement.

When I first married into the Leveilleur family, they patiently taught me all of the fancy etiquette and manners expected of a lady of the house. And, when Alphinaud and Alisaie were born, they spared no effort in helping me look after them. I am thankful to have them with us, each and every day.
Do you have a moment to spare, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>?
I received a letter from Alphinaud, you see, but I wonder if it would be best not to mention our work together in my reply.
It would make for a wonderful surprise when next he returns, but...I imagine Alisaie would be cross to know we kept such secrets. Which, frankly, makes it all the more tempting...
'Tis good to see you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. If I might bend your ear for a moment, there's something I wished to tell you.
When I first began this enterprise, I was riddled with doubt. It was only after you came, and agreed to help, that I began to feel my uncertainty wash away.
I think I now understand why Alphinaud and Alisaie have spoken so highly of you all this time. I very much look forward to seeing what we might achieve together.
Forgive me, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, but do you have a moment? Lest you worry, it is nothing serious. I merely wish to offer a word of thanks.
You have proven to be not only an exceptional business partner, but also a dear friend. Not only to me, but Alphinaud, Alisaie, and even my husband Fourchenault.
Time and again you have risked everything to protect those dearest to me, and no matter how great the peril, you have always given me hope that they would return home.

To put it simply, I've come to think of you as part of the family. I know better than to ask you not do anything reckless─I expect you will always do what you must. But if I may make one request, it would be that you visit after your grand adventures, if only for my peace of mind.
Oh, but look at me, prattling on. I had better let you go. Take care, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, and remember─you are always welcome here.

You have delivered the weekly maximum of six items to Ameliance. You may begin making deliveries again starting <ResetTime>1203</ResetTime><Switch(TopLevelParameter(220))><Case(1)>Sunday</Case><Case(2)>Monday</Case><Case(3)>Tuesday</Case><Case(4)>Wednesday</Case><Case(5)>Thursday</Case><Case(6)>Friday</Case><Case(7)>Saturday</Case></Switch> at <If(TopLevelParameter(218))><Switch(TopLevelParameter(218))><Case(1)>1</Case><Case(2)>2</Case><Case(3)>3</Case><Case(4)>4</Case><Case(5)>5</Case><Case(6)>6</Case><Case(7)>7</Case><Case(8)>8</Case><Case(9)>9</Case><Case(10)>10</Case><Case(11)>11</Case><Case(12)>12</Case><Case(13)>1</Case><Case(14)>2</Case><Case(15)>3</Case><Case(16)>4</Case><Case(17)>5</Case><Case(18)>6</Case><Case(19)>7</Case><Case(20)>8</Case><Case(21)>9</Case><Case(22)>10</Case><Case(23)>11</Case></Switch><Else/>12</If> <If(GreaterThanOrEqualTo(TopLevelParameter(218),12))>p.m.<Else/>a.m.</If> (Earth time).
Knowing you will be with me is somehow reassuring. Just say the word when you are ready to depart.
In order to undertake the next quest, speak with Ameliance as a Disciple of the Hand or the Land.
